intro: Brachycorythis hirschbergii, commonly known as the Hirschberg's rock fern, is a terrestrial fern native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its compact, rock-dwelling growth habit. The plant has dark green, lance-shaped fronds with a leathery texture, and it produces sporangia on the underside of its leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found on rocky outcrops. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
